samples.question: So are you a student or do you work now?
samples.transcript: I am currently working in an engineering consultation firm, but I was student back up until last November, so.
samples.transcript_original: I am currently working in an engineering consultation firm, but I was student back up until last November, so.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I am currently working in an engineering consultation firm, but I was student back up until last November, so.

samples.question: Okay, so why did you choose this job?
samples.transcript: Well, from my, childhood, I really, I was a curious guy. I liked, to, to see how systems and how, things work. so I was in, into engineering from since childhood, but as I grew up, I, I was, leaning towards, data science and computing a little bit. So right now I am, what I am doing is a mixture of both engineering and computer science. So, I think I have, I am on the right path to pursue my, my dream career so far. And, so.

samples.question: How is your daily routine?
samples.transcript: Yeah, I wake up, I prepare myself a cup of coffee and then, usually take a shower in the morning. And, these days we are, working from home. So I just, get my, my laptop ready and log into my system and, see if there is a, if there is a project assigned to me, I will keep working on that. Otherwise, I just stay online until my workday is off around 4 or 5 p.m. I am free to do my personal activities and close taking my dog out for a walk and, you know, getting some stuff done on the computer and going back to bed again. The cycle keeps going. Right.

samples.question: And is there anything about your job you would like to change?
samples.transcript: Well, sometimes I personally prefer to be free on the weekends, but sometimes the workload can drag into the weekend and, that can become a little bit, frustrating over time if you do not get enough break. so I think that workload, I, I would have liked to see that adjusted more into weekdays than, than, than overflowing into my weekends, which is alright for now. And now I would like to move on and ask you some questions about shopping.

samples.question: Describe an important event in your life.
samples.transcript: There are your bullet points. I will give you one minute to.
samples.transcript_original: There are your bullet points. I'll give you one minute to.
samples.transcript_cleaned: There are your bullet points. I will give you one minute to.

samples.question: So what days are important in your country?
samples.transcript: I think there is several cultural dates that are celebrated throughout the country. And one of them is Noru's, I guess, which is the start of spring and the beginning of the Persian New Year. And, yeah, that is one of them. The other one is, I think, Char-Sham-Bissuri, that they actually, people, go around the bonfires and, and, and try to gather with families just before Noru's. And this is just, like, this is another special celebration. Right.
samples.transcript_original: I think there is several cultural dates that are celebrated throughout the country. The other one is, I think, Char-Sham-Bissuri, that they actually, uh, people, uh, uh, go around the bonfires and, and, and try to gather with families just before Noru's. And this is just, like, this is another special celebration. Right.

And this is just, like, this is another special celebration.

samples.question: Okay, and why is it important to have celebrations, do you think?
samples.transcript: Well, I think ultimately the purpose of life is to pursue happiness and to do things that are, that get us closer together with families, with friends, and, and, and, you know, helps us have a good time around them. And, and those are just, I think, excuses to, to, To bring us closer together and let us, you know, have a quality life with Ravlan. Cool.

samples.question: And how is the way your national celebrations are celebrated now different from the way they are celebrated in the past?
samples.transcript: Well, yeah, the environment actually has a, like, has a key role here, and I, yeah, I have to admit, moving up here, things are, you, you, you are less likely to spend that much time on the things you used to celebrate in the past, because, both the environment is not, is not really, Very like demanding in that case and and also your time and your your your schedule is not really adjusted with the celebrations of another country. So you might be working full time and and you cannot you might not even be able to celebrate Noroos or other your other cultural events when you are working Or living in a different country with different celebrations and different types of, you know, cultural influences.

samples.question: Yeah, and do you think any new national celebrations will come into being in the future?

All right.

samples.question: And what are the benefits of having events that many people around the world are celebrating on the same day?
samples.transcript: Well, if everyone is celebrating on the same day, like date or location, those can be, good indicators of how big that event is. And if something is celebrated across many countries, let us say Christmas Day, or, or Boxing Day across many countries, you have, a higher, like, sense of, it is like, you might feel it is a more, sophisticated thing that it actually is because many, many people are doing it. And, you are not the only one. It might kind of motivate you to do your best to prepare for that holiday. Thank you very much. That is the end of the.
